description: Sony developed Vegas Movie Studio before MAGIX acquired it in 2016. MAGIX then rebranded it to VEGAS Movie Studio (also known as VEGAS Movie Studio+DVD), and its target audience was consumers looking to edit home videos and burn them to DVDs .

The VF format was the primary file type supported by VEGAS Movie Studio under Sony and MAGIX for saving projects before exporting them to other formats or burning them. However, MAGIX replaced the software with the entirely different MAGIX Movie Studio in 2021.
